item.title: Steam Version permanently stuck in Fullbright mode
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
TextFAMGUY1:

It’s possible your graphics drivers are defaulting bms.exe to use integrated graphics rather than your graphics card. You will have to look that up in your graphics control panel, and set it to use the graphics card.

Another potential fix is to edit the autoexec.cfg.

Find ‘autoexec’.cfg in SteamApps/common/Black Mesa/bms/cfg and open this file with Notepad

Add the following lines to this file:

mat_dxlevel 95
mat_fullbright 0
mat_hdr_level 2

Save the file and launch the game to see if this fixes your issue.

Yeah I solved the issue a few hours back actually. Turns out the problem was exactly the integrated graphics thing. I had to open up my NVIDIA settings to force it to use my graphics card with Black Mesa. After that, my system finally got the idea of what to do.

Adam-Bomb:

Did you see this?

https://steamcommunity.com/games/362890/announcements/detail/134324240209169224

In fact I did not. Thanks for putting it up!
